head.title: An Umbrella Stand With an Unlikely Muse

hedline.hl1: An Umbrella Stand With an Unlikely Muse

abstract.p: Umbrella stand designed by Giovanni Andrea Panizon is inspired by hairbrush; photo (S)

block.p: Archimedes theorized on the displacement of water in the bathroom. In 1998, Giovanni Andrea Panizon, an Italian architect, made a new discovery there: a hairbrush can hold things in its bristles. ''I immediately envisaged an umbrella -- to stick into that thicket of steel rods.'' The $400 stand, made with Maurizio Martinelli, is 24 inches high and 10 square; MOMA Design Store, 44 West 53rd Street, (800) 793-3167.
